programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Ringo Starr, Barbara Bach, The Oak Ridge Boys, Jerry Seinfeld (5/6/81)
programme.desc: Ringo Starr appears with his wife Barbara Bach. Jerry Seinfeld does his first Tonight Show standup.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Gilda Radner, Walter Cronkite (11/15/83)
programme.desc: Gilda Radner makes her one and only Tonight Show appearance promoting her book.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd (6/6/84)
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd is very passionate about psychic phenomena and is joined by his Ghostbusters co-star Bill Murray.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Steve Lawrence, Rodney Dangerfield, Susan Sarandon, Christopher Reeve (1/31/79)
programme.desc: Rodney Dangerfield cracks up both Johnny and the audience, Christopher Reeve is hot off Superman.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Robin Williams, Jonathan Winters (9/19/91)
programme.desc: Robin Williams has a raucous interview. Jonathan Winters worries about his pets falling down in an earthquake.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Jimmy Stewart, Garry Shandling (12/7/82)
programme.desc: Jimmy Stewart wasn't the greatest Boy Scout then reads a poem, Garry Shandling does standup about air travel.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Very Best of Johnny and Guests - Buddy Hackett, William Shatner (2/3/83)
programme.desc: Buddy Hackett got served a suckling pig at a New York restaurant and William Shatner talks presenting an award.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Billy Crystal (6/11/86)
programme.desc: Billy Crystal sounds off on cable TV vs. satellite dishes. Plus Arnold Schwarzenegger and Michael Ammar.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '70s - Tim Conway (10/15/87)
programme.desc: Tim Conway chats about his 7, count ‘em 7, kids and his career as a practical joker, while in the service.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Jack Lemmon (11/1/89)
programme.desc: The laughs can't stop/won't stop when comedy heavyweights Jack Lemmon and Steven Wright stop by the set.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Bruce Dern (3/2/78)
programme.desc: Robert Klein reports on making a movie with Burt Reynolds and Dr. Carl Sagan bashes Star Wars.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '90s - Tim Allen (1/29/92)
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Melanie Griffith and......the great dog photos by famed photographer William Wegman

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '80s - Susan Sarandon (1/13/84)
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon, Brooke Shields and Carol Wayne all stop by the couch, and Johnny talks about Playboy.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Athletes - Pete Sampras (9/14/90)
programme.desc: Tennis star Pete Sampras celebrates his first major title at the US Open.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Mel Brooks (12/15/83)
programme.desc: Finally, the world has proof that Johnny's desk backdrop isn't real when Mel Brooks reveals all!

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Elia Kazan (8/17/78)
programme.desc: Two-time Oscar-winning director Elia Kazan explains why writing his novel was harder than filmmaking.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Tom Arnold (7/20/90)
programme.desc: Roseanne star Tom Arnold chats about his nervousness to be on the show.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Bob Newhart (5/18/83)
programme.desc: What was Bob Newhart's worst stand-up routine? He tells all in this episode.

programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Billy Crystal (6/11/86)
programme.desc: Billy Crystal sounds off on cable TV vs. satellite dishes. Plus Arnold Schwarzenegger and Michael Ammar.

programme.desc: Tim Conway chats about his 7, count ‘em 7, kids and his career as a practical joker, while in the service.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Robin Williams (10/14/81)
programme.desc: In his first appearance on The Tonight Show, Robin admits he was a geeky kid, discusses herpes, and more.
